cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly in the egg stage develops into a caterpillar (larval stage) when the egg hatches.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an earlier biological life stage or form naturally develops or transitions into a subsequent life stage of the same organism.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: after a few days or weeks
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: StageOrder: egg stage precedes larval (caterpillar) stage

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar prepares to transition into the pupa stage as the next life stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an earlier biological life stage or form naturally develops or transitions into a subsequent life stage of the same organism.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: after caterpillar has grown and stopped eating

remarks: Relation created to encode the developmental progression from caterpillar to pupa.
Relation created to encode the developmental progression from caterpillar to pupa.
Relation created to encode the developmental progression from caterpillar to pupa.
Relation created to encode the developmental progression from caterpillar to pupa.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Metamorphosis is the process that transforms the caterpillar body.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a process or mechanism brings about a transformation of an entity or body, without specifying the resulting form.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar's organs transform into a soupy substance during metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an entity changes form or state into a specified resulting substance, structure, or configuration.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Metamorphic Body Fluids and Liquefied Tissues
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The adult butterfly life stage emerges from the chrysalis at the end of metamorphosis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage physically emerges from a containing or enclosing biological structure.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The newly emerged butterfly has just emerged from the chrysalis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage physically emerges from a containing or enclosing biological structure.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis
remarks: Relation relies on discourse continuity rather than a repeated explicit phrase.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The egg stage is followed by and develops into the larval (caterpillar) stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an earlier biological life stage or form naturally develops or transitions into a subsequent life stage of the same organism.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The larval (caterpillar) stage precedes and transforms into the pupa stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an earlier biological life stage or form naturally develops or transitions into a subsequent life stage of the same organism.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The pupa stage transitions into the adult butterfly life stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an earlier biological life stage or form naturally develops or transitions into a subsequent life stage of the same organism.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage physically emerges from a containing or enclosing structure.
args.justification: The two relations already use relation_name='emerges_from' and describe the generic emergence of an organism from a containing structure (the chrysalis). The current canonical_rel_name 'emerges_from_structure' is an unnecessary, idiosyncratic variant and should be normalized to the simpler, schema-consistent predicate 'emerges_from'. The relation class and group are already appropriate and are kept.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage physically emerges from a containing or enclosing structure.
executed_decisions.justification: The two relations already use relation_name='emerges_from' and describe the generic emergence of an organism from a containing structure (the chrysalis). The current canonical_rel_name 'emerges_from_structure' is an unnecessary, idiosyncratic variant and should be normalized to the simpler, schema-consistent predicate 'emerges_from'. The relation class and group are already appropriate and are kept.
